page.title: 14Social Provision in Adisham
page.content: There is no evidence of poverty in Adisham and little unemployment. The villagers organise a prescription service and arrange outings. Home Helps are sent as needed and there is a visiting barber. There is a telephone box, two postal collections daily and a mobile library visits weekly. Money is raised locally for equipment for the children. General fears were the atom bomb, violence, burglary, drugs,and pollution. The elderly regretted the loss of trees and atmosphere due to increased building and population. They also feared the closure of the station and shop. Canterbury Planning Authority were condemned for allowing excessive building and planning generally. Farmers stubble burning and spraying aroused concern. There was also concern about the lack of poten- tial leaders for future activities.
